reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the most perfect stay here. We opted for one of the suites right on the sea front. Beautifully decorated room, excellent bath room and nice large balcony. Every night we fell asleep to the sound of the waves. We ate at the Eden-Roc Restaurant and by far this was the best food we had throughout our trip. The whole stay was perfect.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: We have been going to this hotel every June for many years and love it. We always feel pampered and relaxed after our visit. The hotel has an old world luxury feel to it. It is very tranquil.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are the positives: (i) location, location, location, (ii) service, (iii) the pool-an infinity pool that blends into the Mediterranean, and (iv) the grounds--just spectacular. The negatives are (i) it is pricey--not just the hotel room but also the food/drinks/spa (lunch for two at the Grill is easily $150), (ii) it does not have the smaller amenities (mini-bar, newspaper) that a lot of big American hotels have, and (iii) the square pillows are odd, but you get used to them.
reviews.title: Old style Hotel in great surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews in which people complain about the service. I have never experienced bad service there. In fact, the staff goes beyond the call of duty. They will strive to meet your every whim and, through the years, I have seen lots of whims--crepes at 3:00 am, no problem! I think the key to getting great service is just being nice and pleasant. If you are a snob, they can out-snob you in an instant. Go there with the mind to enjoy and relax in breathtaking surroundings and you will!
reviews.title: Location: A+, Service/Amenities: C-

reviews.text: What one can add about the Hotel du Cap? Just that it is one of the best Hotels in the World.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, can't wait to get back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel with beautiful gardens its very romantic to walk around, there is lots of privacy at some stages you could feel alone in your own paradise which was great.. They also have beautiful pool of a cliff edge with amazing views. The only problem was I did not know it was a salt pool and dived in and could not see where I was going with salt in my eyes.. The restaurant was very good and again fantastic views. The rooms of the hotel were ok for €700 Euros a night I really expect more.. The staff again were ok but typically French so a little arrogant which again when I pay good money I don’t expect especially when travelling the world you become fussy.
reviews.title: A hotel with wonderful views..

reviews.text: I would visit again as there is something special about this place.
reviews.title: TOP NOTCH HOTEL ! highly recommended place..!

reviews.text: It does a real long time i should have wrote this few words even if i really know that this place doesn’t really need my support..as already know in the all world as the EXCELLENCE;
reviews.title: The Blanchette/Mercier/Sella Family remembers

reviews.text: Top place& top location & top service& top gastronomy & top privacy..
reviews.title: In LOVE with Hotel du Cap

reviews.text: What else?
reviews.title: Something sublime gets even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel du Cap Eden Roc is staggeringly spectacular. The staff is nice, competent, and cheerful. Our room had 2 full marble bathrooms, 4 giant windows with shutters, a chandelier and ample closets. Room service was instant. The pool and ocean front activities were such fun. The food at the restaurants was consistently excellent - fresh and local. The concierges (Anthony gets special mention) took care of everything we wanted - dinner reservations, transportation by helicopter - all with effortless finesse. We will make this an annual trip thanks to the Hotel du Cap - well done!
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way...

reviews.text: I'v just returned from a 3 night stay in this great hotel.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel and surroundings- Grossley expensive

reviews.text: The Hotel and its surrounding are stunning. I stayed in one of the Eden Roc Suites they were very comfortable and had a lovely view of the Frence Riviera. We ate every evening in the main Resteraunt which was also very nice.
reviews.title: Had a good time - but wouldn't go back in a hurry

reviews.text: The Hotel is a good 5 star hotel but thats as far as i would go. Everything is so stupidly expensive. My Suite was the equivelent of £1500 per night! The general standard of the hotel doesnt reflect the extortionate prices. When we left on the last day we paid the bill but when we looked at it later they have charged for a breakfast, Cigars and 20 euros for something unexplainable. We had none of these items. They also promices a mini bar in each room that only appeared after our second request. When it did eventually appear there was an empty fridge with 8 (litre) bottles of Whisky and a bottle of gin on top??? I asked for mixers and soft drinks that never arrived.
reviews.title: If you like expensive and pretentious...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole we found the location, grounds and view were second too none! However the hotel was far to expensive for the service we received.
reviews.title: Fabulous perfect service - you need a local chauffeur to truly enjoy little known areas in Provence fo day outings.

reviews.text: What is there not too love about this property? Everything from the facilities to the location to the service are outstanding!
reviews.title: Best Resort Ever!!

reviews.text: Situated about 20 minutes west of the Nice airport in "Cap D'Antibes", the Hotel du Cap Eden Roc is paradise.
reviews.title: a legend is a legend

reviews.text: This season was the first year since the hotel had rennovated it's rooms and they are breathtaking. We stayed in a Junior Suite in the Hotel du Cap (Eden-Roc is a separate building by the ocean) and thought it was stunning. From sunset or late night drinks on the terrace to being at the Bellini Bar for a nightcap it was magnificance in an opulent surrounding.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Europe, maybe even in the world

reviews.text: The Concierge at this property were absolutely amazing. Gilles (head concierge), and Fred were the best looking after our every request from dinner reservations to airport transportation.
reviews.title: Majestic ,heavenly retreat .almost paradiselike atmosphere!

reviews.text: The Spa features La Prairie products and treatments and is expensive (200 Euros for the average 60 minute massage) but totally worth it!
reviews.title: Not what it used to be
